meanings.definition: Of or relating to equal angles.
meanings.sent1: The two isogonic lines formed identical angles.
meanings.sent2: The isogonic triangle had three equal angles.
meanings.sent3: The isogonic square was a funny shape with all sides the same length.
meanings.sent4: Her isogonic approach to problem-solving always led to balanced solutions.
meanings.sent5: The isogonic relationship between the angles made the geometry lesson easy to understand.

meanings.definition: A line on a map connecting points of equal magnetic variation.
meanings.sent1: The isogonic on the map showed where the magnetic variation was the same.
meanings.sent2: We followed the isogonic to navigate through the magnetic field.
meanings.sent3: The isogonic on the map looked like a squiggly line connecting different points.
meanings.sent4: She traced the isogonic with her finger, trying to find the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The isogonic line on the map helped sailors stay on course during their journey.
